contentrichtext.text: {{other people|Gareth Thomas}} {{Infobox MP |honorific-prefix = |name = Gareth Thomas |honorific-suffix = |image = |office = [[Member of Parliament (United Kingdom)|Member of Parliament]] <br> for [[Clwyd West (UK Parliament constituency)|Clwyd West]] |parliament = |majority = |term_start = 1 May 1997 |term_end = 5 May 2005 |predecessor = [[Boundary Commissions (United Kingdom)|Constituency Created]] |successor = [[David Jones (MP for Clwyd West)|David Jones]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1954|09|25|df=yes}} |birth_place = [[Penygroes, Gwynedd]] |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |birthname = |nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] |party = [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] |otherparty = |spouse = |relations = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = [[Aberystwyth University]] |occupation = |profession = |cabinet = |committees = |portfolio = |religion = |signature = |website = }} '''Gareth Thomas''' (born September 25, 1954) is a [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] politician in the [[United Kingdom]]. He was Member of Parliament for [[Clwyd West (UK Parliament constituency)|Clwyd West]] 1997-2005. ==Early life== Born in [[Penygroes, Gwynedd]], Thomas is the son of a toolmaker. Although brought up on [[Merseyside]] he is a fluent [[Welsh language]] speaker. He went to Rock Ferry High School on Ravenswood Avenue in [[Rock Ferry]], [[Birkenhead]]. After graduating in law ([[Bachelor of Laws|LLB]]) from the [[University of Wales, Aberystwyth]] in 1976, he was initially employed in the insurance industry and managed a loss adjusting company in the [[West Indies]]. He graduated from the [[Council of Legal Education]] (CLE) in 1977. He has been a [[barrister]] in a private practice since 1986 specialising in personal injury litigation and is a member of [[Amicus]]. ==Parliamentary career== A member of [[Flintshire]] [[County Council]] between 1995–97, Thomas was elected to Parliament in the [[United Kingdom general election, 1997|1997 general election]]. His political interests include Wales, legal reform, social security and the environment. He was a member of the [[Select Committee on Welsh Affairs]], the Select Committee on Social Security and the [[Joint Human Rights Committee]]. Following the [[United Kingdom general election, 2001|2001 general election]] he was appointed [[Parliamentary Private Secretary]] to the [[Secretary of State for Wales]], [[Paul Murphy (UK politician)|Paul Murphy]], and in October 2002 moved with Murphy to the [[Northern Ireland Office]] in the same capacity. He was a member of Labour's Parliamentary Campaign Team. At the [[United Kingdom general election, 2005|2005 general election]], Thomas was narrowly defeated by the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative Party]] candidate [[David Jones (MP for Clwyd West)|David Jones]]. Before 1997, Clwyd West had been regarded as a safe Conservative seat and now appears to be reverting to its traditional character. Thomas has returned to the legal profession, working as a barrister at Atlantic Chambers Liverpool. He has stated that he has no aspirations to return to Westminster. ==Personal life== Outside of politics, Thomas' interests include restoring old buildings, traditional rural crafts and [[Italy]]. He continues to live in his former constituency near [[Ruthin]].
